intro: Werauhia paupera, commonly known as the poor werauhia, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. The flowers are typically greenish-white with reddish or purple bracts, adding visual interest. Werauhia paupera is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
